messages.content: The July 2024 MiFID II amendment adds two key obligations: (1) All new and existing financial products must include ESG‑related characteristics in the pre‑contractual brochure, requiring updates to the Product‑Governance & Disclosure Policy (CTRL‑001). (2) Transaction‑reporting must now be submitted within 30 minutes of execution, tightening the timeline defined in the Transaction Reporting Procedure (CTRL‑002). Both changes increase compliance workload and data‑capture requirements but improve market transparency.

arguments.title: MiFID II Amendment 2024‑07 – Immediate Action Required
arguments.body:
## Summary of Changes
- **ESG Disclosure** (Art.5‑1): Update product‑governance documents to include ESG characteristics in pre‑contractual brochures.
- **Transaction Reporting** (Art.7‑3): Adjust reporting systems to meet a 30‑minute deadline.

**Recommended Actions**:
1. Review and amend the Product‑Governance & Disclosure Policy (CTRL‑001).
2. Update the Transaction Reporting Procedure (CTRL‑002) and ensure system capability for 30‑minute reporting.
3. Assign owners and set a compliance‑by‑date of 30 Sept 2024.

arguments.content: Full text of MiFID II Amendment 2024‑07 (see parsed clauses).

messages.content:
Here is the concise, business‑focused summary of the recent MiFID II changes:

- **ESG Disclosure (Art.5‑1)**: All financial products must now disclose ESG characteristics in pre‑contractual brochures. This impacts our Product‑Governance & Disclosure Policy (CTRL‑001).
- **Transaction Reporting (Art.7‑3)**: Reporting deadline shortened to 30 minutes post‑execution, requiring updates to the Transaction Reporting Procedure (CTRL‑002).

**Next steps**:
1. Update the relevant policies (CTRL‑001, CTRL‑002) by 30 Sept 2024.
2. Assign owners to implement system changes.

An alert with these details has been sent to the compliance Slack channel and the compliance lead’s email, and the amendment has been logged in the compliance database (Record ID: REG-2024-07-00123).
